content.title: National Awards For Empowerment Of Persons With Disabilities: National Awards For Institutions Engaged In Empowering Persons With Disabilities: Sugamya Bharat Abhiyan Ke Karyanvayan/badhamukta Vatavaran Ke Srijan Mein Sarvshrestha Rajya/ Ut/ Zila
content.department: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.details: The 'National Awards for Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities' are being awarded by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment every year since 1969 in recognition of the skills and contribution of persons with disabilities, individuals and institutions engaged in the empowerment of persons with disabilities. The 'Sugamya Bharat Abhiyan Ke Karyanvayan/Badhamukta Vatavaran Ke Srijan Mein Sarvshrestha Rajya/ UT/ Zila' award is given for outstanding work in Sugamya Bharat Abhiyan and the creation of a barrier-free environment.
benefits: The Awardee is given a Certificate and a Shield
Boarding and lodging expenses of the awardees and one escort shall be borne by the Department
To and fro travelling expenses and accommodation for up to one day prior to and after the day of the awards ceremony shall be arranged and reimbursed
eligibility: Total number of Public buildings in the State
Total Number of Public buildings identified for the creation of the barrier-free environment
Total number of public buildings made accessible from Accessible India Campaign funds
Total number of cost estimates sent to the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities
Total number of buildings for which funds have been given and utilized
The total number of buildings retrofitted with accessibility features
The total number of buildings made accessible from state funds
Other important initiatives taken up to improve the accessibility of public buildings
content.application_process: Online applications are invited through the centralized portal of the Ministry of Home Affairs. The application should be in Hindi or English language only.
documents_required: Certificate of Registration (showing the Year of Establishment)
Proofs regarding the Nature of work undertaken by the Institution
Special or Outstanding Achievements in the past 10 years
Details of Awards or Honours received, if any
Any other Achievement for Consideration of the Award

faqs.question: When Was The 'National Award For The Empowerment Of Persons With Disabilities' First Introduced?
faqs.answer: The 'National Award for the Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities' was first introduced in the year 1969.

faqs.question: What Are The Objectives Of These Awards?
faqs.answer: The awards are conferred to recognize the skills and contributions of persons with disabilities, individuals and institutions engaged in their empowerment.

faqs.question: When Were The Guidelines For These Awards Last Revised?
faqs.answer: The guidelines for the National Awards for Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities were revised and implemented from the year 2021.

faqs.question: On Which Date And Month Are The 'National Award For The Empowerment Of Persons With Disabilities' Conferred?
faqs.answer: The awards are conferred on 3rd December every year, which is the International Day of Persons with Disabilities.

faqs.question: Who Confers These Awards?
faqs.answer: The awards are conferred by the Hon'ble President or Hon'ble Vice President of India at Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi.
